title: The Papers: Passport strike and arrest warrant for Putin
description: A walkout by staff at the Passport Office and Putin being accused of war crimes lead Saturday's papers.

title: Queen's gallantry awards recognise London Bridge attack heroes
description: Five of the civilian commendations go to men who confronted the London Bridge attacker in 2019.

title: Menindee: Millions of dead fish wash up near Australian town
description: "Just imagine leaving a fish in your kitchen to rot" said one resident, describing the smell.

title: Nottingham Forest 1-2 Newcastle: Alexander Isak scores dramatic late winner over Forest
description: Newcastle's Alexander Isak scores a dramatic stoppage-time winner over Nottingham Forest to keep their hopes of a top-four finish firmly alive.

title: Heathrow security to strike for 10 days including Easter
description: The airport says contingency plans will be in place when 1,400 guards walk out in a pay dispute.

title: Jeff Molina: American UFC fighter comes out as bisexual after private video leaked
description: UFC fighter Jeff Molina comes out as bisexual after a private video of him was leaked.

title: Can Vladimir Putin actually be arrested?
description: The ICC has issued an arrest warrant for the Russian president for alleged war crimes in Ukraine.

title: Will Vladimir Putin ever face a war crimes trial?
description: Despite the charges against him at the Hague, the chances of a prosecution for Ukraine war crimes are slim.

title: Hunter Biden sues repairman over release of personal data from laptop
description: The US president's embattled son is under renewed scrutiny from Republicans in Congress.

title: Lance Reddick, star of The Wire and John Wick, dies aged 60
description: Reddick, who played Charon in the John Wick action-thriller movies, died of natural causes.

title: Crystal Palace: Roy Hodgson being considered as Patrick Vieira replacement
description: Former Crystal Palace boss Roy Hodgson is being considered as an option to take over as manager at Selhurst Park after the sacking of Patrick Vieira.

title: 'She empowered women in the bedroom and the boardroom'
description: Jacqueline Gold, whose death was announced on Friday, changed the lives of women at home and at work.

title: George Floyd killer Derek Chauvin convicted of tax fraud
description: The disgraced former policeman and his now-ex-wife lied about their taxable income between 2014 and 2019.

title: Met Police: Sir Stephen House to be investigated over alleged rape comments
description: It is claimed Sir Stephen House described the bulk of rape complaints as "regretful sex".

title: St Patrick's Day: Varadkar meets Biden at White House
description: The Taoiseach is at the White House for traditional St Patrick's Day reception with the US president.

title: Kyle Walker indecent exposure allegation dealt with, police say
description: The England and Man City star will not face charges over indecent exposure allegations, police say.

title: Cheltenham 2023: Willie Mullins savours 'mind-blowing' Festival success
description: Willie Mullins says he is struggling to take in his success after Galopin Des Champs gave him a third Gold Cup and 94th Cheltenham Festival victory.

title: Jurassic Park actor Sam Neill reveals 'ferocious' cancer diagnosis
description: The Jurassic Park star opens up about living with non-Hodgkin lymphoma and more in his new memoir.

title: Widower's plea for answers over wife's grave mix-up
description: Thomas Duncan accuses a council of treating his wife as if she does not matter after the grave mix-up.

title: Miley Cyrus achieves UK chart double
description: She tops both the album and singles chart, while UK Eurovision entrant Mae Muller makes the top 40.

title: Migrants turn themselves over to Canadian police at the border
description: Two Afghans are among thousands of migrants using an unofficial border crossing to enter Canada.

title: Junior doctors' strike led to 175,000 cancellations
description: Over 175,000 appointments and procedures had to be cancelled due to the three-day walkout, figures show.

title: Six Nations 2023: How England can 'hang on' against Ireland
description: Give it to Henry Arundell, get physical and hang on - how England can avoid setting any more sorry records against Ireland.

title: St Patrick's Day: Thousands gather for events in NI
description: People are taking part in the celebrations, including big parades, concerts and family events.

title: Cheltenham Gold Cup 2023: Galopin Des Champs wins from Bravemansgame
description: Galopin Des Champs storms clear to win a dramatic Cheltenham Gold Cup for trainer Willie Mullins and jockey Paul Townend.

title: YouTube reinstates Donald Trump's channel
description: It is the latest social media channel to restore his account following Twitter, Facebook and Instagram.

title: Arrest warrant issued for Putin over war crime allegations
description: The Russian president is wanted by the International Criminal Court for his invasion of Ukraine.

title: Snoop Dogg arrives in Scotland to Still D.R.E on bagpipes
description: Hip hop legend Snoop Dogg has been welcomed into Scotland by the sounds of Still D.R.E on the pipes.

title: Covid tests for China travellers to England to end
description: The government says the voluntary testing of people flying into England will no longer be required.

title: Credit Suisse shares hit as investor fears reignite
description: Investors are selling shares despite an overnight rescue deal for America's First Republic.

title: Why US mothers are more likely to die in childbirth
description: Maternal mortality spiked by 40 percent in 2021, with black women more likely to die.

title: Formula 1: Red Bull dominate Saudi Arabian GP first practice
description: Red Bull pick up at the Saudi Arabian Grand Prix where they left off in Bahrain two weeks ago by dominating first practice in Jeddah.

title: Manchester United and Sir Jim Ratcliffe: Prospective owner visits Old Trafford
description: Prospective Manchester United owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe visits Old Trafford as part of the process of the club's potential sale.

title: Gareth Southgate: England boss worried about 'decreasing' number of English players
description: Gareth Southgate voices concerns about what he says is a decreasing number of England players that he is able to pick from in the Premier League.

title: Emily Lewis: Speedboat skipper sentenced after teenager's death in crash
description: Emily Lewis, 15, suffered fatal injuries when she was crushed against a metal handrail in the crash.

title: Christian Atsu: Ghana funeral for footballer killed by Turkey earthquake
description: Mourners pay their last respects to Christian Atsu, seen by many in Ghana as a national hero.

title: Testing offered over Orkney breast cancer gene
description: People on the island of Westray are to be offered testing for a gene variant which can lead to a higher cancer risk

title: Aldi raises pay as supermarkets battle for staff
description: The supermarket group has raised its national hourly wage to £11.40 and £12.85 for Greater London.

title: Ban on imports of animal hunting trophies set to become law
description: Plans to stop hunters bringing body parts of endangered species to Great Britain are approved by MPs.

title: Peer's sex abuse prison sentence more than halved
description: The Appeal Court says it took into account Nazir Ahmed was a child himself when he abused two children.

title: Billie Jean King Cup: Emma Raducanu absent as Great Britain name squad for France qualifier
description: Great Britain name an unchanged squad to face France in their Billie Jean King Cup qualifier, with Emma Raducanu unavailable for selection.

title: PC who hit ex-footballer Dalian Atkinson guilty of gross misconduct
description: A disciplinary hearing finds Mary Ellen Bettley-Smith used excessive force against the ex-footballer.

title: Kremlin aims to destroy Ukraine jets after Poland and Slovakia pledges
description: Slovakia becomes the second Nato country after Poland to offer Soviet-era fighter jets to Ukraine.

title: In pictures: The Crown films in St Andrews
description: The next series of the Netflix show will cover the period the Prince of Wales was at university.

title: Barrister hits out at government response to report into domestic killers
description: The government should take on more of my suggestions, says the head of a review into domestic abuse murders.

title: Europa League quarter-final draw: Man Utd to play Sevilla
description: Manchester United will meet Spanish side Sevilla in the quarter-finals of the Europa League.

title: Comic Relief returns with The Traitors and Eurovision sketches
description: This year's event will support people struggling with the cost of living crisis and food poverty.

title: Harrogate Turkish Baths bans nude bathing amid police investigation
description: Swimwear is made compulsory at the baths in Harrogate after a "serious" incident, a spokesman said.

title: When are passport office strikes and how to renew your UK passport?
description: How will the strike by Passport Office workers affect passport renewals?

title: Champions League quarter-final draw: Chelsea to play Real Madrid, Man City v Bayern Munich
description: Chelsea face holders Real Madrid in the quarter-finals of the Champions League, while Manchester City meet Bayern Munich.

title: Give babies peanut butter to cut allergy by 77%, study says
description: Research suggests there is a crucial window during weaning to lower the allergy risk.

title: Dominic Raab plans new law to stop whole life term prisoners marrying
description: The justice secretary says he will block murderers like Levi Bellfield getting married in prison.

title: Jodey Whiting: Court of Appeal grants new benefit death inquest
description: Jodey Whiting died in February 2017 just days after her disability benefits were wrongfully stopped.

title: Ann Summers boss Jacqueline Gold dies aged 62
description: Ms Gold was credited from transforming the company into a multi-million pound business.

title: Premier League fantasy football tips: Is it time to sell Ivan Toney?
description: BBC Radio 5 Live's Alistair Bruce-Ball offers his fantasy football tips and looks at the possibility of selling Brentford forward Ivan Toney.

title: Teachers' strikes in England paused for talks
description: Talks between the government and unions will focus on teacher pay, conditions and workload reduction.

title: Boris Johnson reselected as candidate for Uxbridge and South Ruislip
description: There had been speculation the former PM might try to find a safer seat before the next election.

title: Farrell v Farrell - inside the dynamic of rugby's first family
description: Ireland coach Andy Farrell insists battling with his son Owen in big games such as Saturday's Grand Slam contest with England doesn't cause him any anxiety.

title: The Great British Bake Off: Alison Hammond replaces Matt Lucas as co-host
description: She will take Matt Lucas's place at Noel Fielding's side on the Channel 4 baking show.

title: Ticketmaster offers partial refunds to The Cure fans
description: The company came under fire after added fees doubled the cost of some tickets to see The Cure.

title: Potatoes bury people after roof collapses in India
description: Rescuers search through piles of vegetables after the accident at the storage facility in Sambhal, Uttar Pradesh.

title: Patrick Vieira: Crystal Palace sack manager after 12-game winless run
description: Crystal Palace sack manager Patrick Vieira after a 12-match winless run which has left the Eagles three points above the relegation zone.

title: China's Xi to meet Putin in Moscow next week
description: Xi Jinping is travelling to Moscow to meet Russian President Vladimir Putin next week, the Chinese government confirms.

title: Indian Wells: Iga Swiatek and Carlos Alcaraz reach semi-finals
description: World number one Iga Swiatek continues her pursuit of back-to-back Indian Wells titles as she cruises past Sorana Cirstea to reach the semi-finals.

title: Dedicated father's 21-year mission to photograph son
description: Ian McLeod has captured every day of his son's life growing up for the ultimate family album.

title: Government signs £2.9m Moon base nuclear power deal with Rolls-Royce
description: Research will look at how to provide energy allowing humans live and work on the Moon.

title: Vincent Kompany's three FA Cup finals with Manchester City as Burnley boss returns to the Etihad
description: Take a look back at Vincent Kompany's three FA Cup finals with Manchester City before his return to Etihad Stadium as manager of Burnley in this year's quarter-finals.

title: Ukraine will remember who backed us - foreign minister
description: Ukraine's foreign minister tells the BBC nations that don't back Ukraine will be held to account.

title: Iraq War: Ali Abbas lost both arms in the war
description: Ali Abbas's life changed forever after he lost both of his arms and most of his family in the war.

title: Calls for talks to end junior doctors' strikes
description: Unions and ministers are being urged to start talks after a pay breakthrough with other NHS workers.

title: UK tourism: Visitor attractions suffering long Covid - industry body
description: Visitor figures are 23% down on pre-pandemic levels, despite millions returning in 2022.

title: 'A village's goodwill saved me from life on the streets'
description: A new report on rural homelessness reveals low funding has left rough sleepers relying on goodwill.

title: Passport office workers to strike for five weeks over pay dispute
description: The strike action will have a "significant impact" on deliveries of passports as summer approaches.

title: Hemsby: How many other communities are at risk of erosion?
description: What can be done to protect coastal communities at risk of being swallowed up by the sea?

title: Australian shreds record for longest surf session
description: Blake Johnston has been riding waves for over 30 hours and plans to keep going.

title: The Papers: NHS pay deal and 'Banks try to reassure investors'
description: A deal that would give health workers a 5% rise and ongoing turmoil in the markets lead the papers.

title: Arsenal out of Europe: How will Europa League loss affect title challenge?
description: 'Disappointment but clarity'. Is Arsenal's Europa League exit a blessing in disguise or could it impact their Premier League title challenge?

title: Killers with history of coercive behaviour face tougher sentences
description: Proposed new laws will target murderers with a history of controlling behaviour towards their victims.

title: Indian-made eyedrops recalled in US after injuries
description: Patients lose vision and have eyes surgically removed after using eyedrops now recalled in the US.

title: The prison mum experience Elizabeth Holmes is desperate to avoid
description: The US is one of four countries that routinely separates incarcerated mothers from their babies.

title: The NHS pay dispute could soon be over, but we are not there yet
description: Union members are yet to back the deal, and the government still needs to pay for it, says Chris Mason.

title: What has happened to pay in the UK?
description: Workers are calling for improved pay to tackle the cost of living crisis, but how have wages changed?

title: Three million drivers' licence delays since 2020, report finds
description: People with medical conditions waited months for driving licences during the pandemic, MPs say.

title: Royal Mail referred to Ofcom over late letter deliveries
description: Royal Mail is systematically falling down on its obligation to deliver letters, MPs say.
